results.title: All that jazz [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Robert A Aurthur and Bob Fosse
results.brief_description: Joe Gideon is a chain-smoking, pill popping workaholic obsessed with producing, directing and choreographing a Broadway musical while womanising and editing his latest film (actually Fosse’s own film “Lenny”). This semi-autobiographical musical drama is framed by Gideon’s conversations with a mysterious figure of nemesis the “Lady in White”. Following Gideon’s heart attack, the film assumes a surreal hallucinatory logic. Not only does Fosse borrow freely from the European classics “8 1/2” and “The Seventh seal” but he inverts the showbiz and life affirming “That’s entertainment” ethos of the traditional musical. Cast includes Roy Scheider, Jessica Lange, Ann Reinking and John Lithgow. Awards: Winner, Best Art Direction, Costume Design, Editing, Best Score, Academy Awards, 1979.

results.title: All that heaven allows [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Universal International Pictures, Ross Hunter and Douglas Sirk
results.brief_description: A respected middle-aged New England widow (Jane Wyman) with two grown children becomes the victim of smalltown gossip when she rejects socially acceptable alternatives for the love of her gardener, a much younger man (Rock Hudson). Sirk uncovers something of the paradox of middle America in the fifties - gleaming surfaces masking a crisis in values - by using the elements of the woman’s melodrama from within to expose the confining complacency and emotional aridity of small town middle-class life. Cast also includes Agnes Moorhood, Virginia Grey, Gloria Talbot and William Reynolds.

results.title: All that glitters
results.brief_description: In September 1982, forty-five nations of the Commonwealth sent 1,500 athletes to Brisbane for the Twelfth Commonwealth Games. This program focuses on athletes and coaches, highlighting their relationships, lifestyles and training and their individual struggles. This film is the official film of the 12th Commonwealth Games, held in Brisbane, and is a combination of the films featured in the “Striving ” series.

results.title: All that glitters
results.creator_credit: Filmline International, Kinsman Media Corporation and Richard Miner
results.brief_description: This film shows the origin, uses and economic value of gold, and the different ways in which gold and gold equities might be purchased, It traces the history of the lustruous precious metal, its romance and its economic importance.

results.title: All that Bach
results.creator_credit: Niv Fichman, Louise Clark and Larry Weinstein
results.brief_description: All that Bach is a delightful celebration of the music of J S Bach as it is played, danced, sung, jazzed, computed, tapped, electrified and busked by a wide range of internationally renowned artists. Among the performers highlighted in this spectacular homage are jazz pianist Keith Jarratt, Christopher Hogwood and the Academy of Ancient Music, contralto Maureen Forrester, cellist Anner Bylsma, the Canadian Bass and the National Tap Dance Company. “All that Bach” is an entertaining feast that revels in the richness of Bach’s musical legacy.

results.title: All summer in a day
results.creator_credit: Learning Corporation of America, Karl Epstein and Ed Kaplan
results.brief_description: Based on a short story by Ray Bradbury, this short film is set on a planet where the sun shines for only a few minutes once every nine years. Margot, a frail loner, wistfully recalls her days on sunny Earth and waits longingly for the rare appearance of the sun. But she pays dearly for her sensitivity when, as a victim of teasing, she is locked in a closet for the duration of the event. The other children, overwhelmed by the sun’s warmth, have forgotten and left her there. By the time they release her it’s too late - the rain has begun to fall. This is a tale of the destructive nature of thoughtlessness and cruelty.

results.title: All star casting
results.creator_credit: Big Six Film Unit and Edward Cook
results.brief_description: Describes the processes employed in a large British foundry. Begins in the pattern makers shop and then shows making of sand moulds. After pouring, the moulds are allowed to cool and then broken to remove castings. Moulding sand is collected for re-use. Shock blasting is employed to clean castings after which they are machined and annealed. Castings manufactured by the firm include parts for tractors, fork lifting trucks, cranes, excavators and internal combustion engines.

results.title: All set backstage
results.creator_credit: Prahran College of Advanced Education and Paul Cox
results.brief_description: The name of J.C. Williamson has long been associated with the theatre in Australia. In an early Paul Cox short film, he takes an historical look at J.C. Williamson and some of the famous acts they brought to Australia. Narrated by Lady Viola Tait.

results.title: All rounder
results.brief_description: This interesting vignette from the Movietone News programs compares a motor vehicle driver to an all-round cricketer. Most cricketers specialise in one aspect of the game, but an all-rounder can prove a most valuable asset to a team, as Richie Benaud did for the Australian team in the test series. Drivers, too need all-round skills; reckless driving and a lack of concentration are fatal on both the oval and the road! No other credits available.
